cityDescription: Amsterdam’s intriguing history spans seven centuries. From humble beginnings as a small village to a world power in the 17th century, Amsterdam today is a fascinating mix of history and commerce.
Tel Aviv, a city on Israel’s Mediterranean coast, is marked by stark 1930s Bauhaus buildings, thousands of which are clustered in the White City architectural area.
Shanghai, on China’s central coast, is the country's biggest city and a global financial hub.
Seattle is surrounded by water, mountains and evergreen forests, and contains thousands of acres of parkland.
Financial center with a tropical climate and multicultural population. Singapore, an island city-state off southern Malaysia.
Historical city in the heart of Europe and Asia
